common.usage: To use the {{component}} component, simply import it into your React file (fr):

accordion.title: Accordion (fr)

propertiesDescription.activeIcon: Icon to display when the accordion item is active (fr).
propertiesDescription.canSelfCollapse: Allows the active item to collapse when clicked again (fr).
propertiesDescription.children: The accordion items to display. Each child must provide a title and content (fr).
propertiesDescription.className: Additional CSS classes to apply to the accordion wrapper (fr).
propertiesDescription.defaultActiveIndex: The initially active accordion item index (fr).
propertiesDescription.direction: Defines the orientation of the accordion, either vertical or horizontal (fr).
propertiesDescription.inactiveIcon: Icon to display when the accordion item is inactive (fr).

accordion.subtitle: The accordion component is a collapsible content display element that allows users to expand or collapse sections with optional icons, orientations, and self-collapse behavior (fr).

button.title: Button (fr)
button.subtitle: The Button component is a flexible and customizable button implementation for React applications. It supports various properties for styling, behavior, and functionality, making it suitable for different use cases. (fr)

checkboxInput.title: CheckboxInput (fr)
checkboxInput.subtitle: The CheckboxInput component is a versatile and reusable component that supports both single and multiple checkbox selections. It allows for customization through a variety of props and handles validation, error messages, and helper texts. (fr)

usage.customLabel: Custom label for single checkbox input (fr)
usage.customOptionsLabel: Custom label for multiple checkbox input (fr)
usage.customOptionsLabelDescription: The `renderOptionsLabel` function in a checkbox group allows custom rendering of options label. You can use it to display rich content like icons, descriptions, or formatted text. (fr)

confirmationModal.title: Confirmation modal (fr)
confirmationModal.message: Are you sure you want to proceed? (fr)

propertiesDescription.data: Custom country data to overwrite existing entries or add new ones. (fr)
propertiesDescription.exclude: An array of country codes to remove from the list. (fr)
propertiesDescription.favorites: An array of country codes to prioritize and display at the top of the list. (fr)
propertiesDescription.include: An array of country codes (e.g., ['US', 'DE']). Only these countries will be visible. (fr)
propertiesDescription.label: The label text displayed above the picker. (fr)
propertiesDescription.locale: The locale code (e.g., 'en', 'fr'). Accepts custom codes (like 'np') if provided in data. (fr)
propertiesDescription.multiple: If true, allows selecting multiple countries. (fr)
propertiesDescription.name: The name attribute for the input field. (fr)
propertiesDescription.onChange: Callback function triggered when the selection changes. (fr)
propertiesDescription.placeholder: Placeholder text displayed when no selection is made. (fr)
propertiesDescription.value: The currently selected country code (or array of codes if multiple). (fr)

data.title: Data (fr)
data.subtitle: The Data component is a reusable React component designed to display a labeled value. (fr)

dropdownMenu.subtitle: The Dropdown component provides an accessible and customizable menu for selecting actions or options. It supports labels, icons, slots for custom triggers and icons, and emits events on selection (fr).
dropdownMenu.title: Dropdown menu (fr)

usage.hiddenDropdownIcon: Hidden dropdown icon with default label (fr)

basic.title: Basic (fr)
basic.description: Editable title can be used by passing a `title` property. Title level is optional, it is `h1` by default. `onblur` event on the title input field triggers `onUpdate` method. (fr)

controlled.title: Controlled (fr)
controlled.description: Editable title can be used as a controllable element by passing `onChange` property. Note this will impact the performance of the component. (fr)

disabled.description: The edit function can be disabled. To do this, pass the `allowEdit` option with value `false`. (fr)
disabled.title: Disabled edit (fr)

customToggler.description: The toggle button can be customized by pass your own toggler using `toggler` prop. (fr)
customToggler.title: Custom toggler (fr)

editableTitle.subtitle: Editable title is an extension to a page or section title which can be edited. (fr)
editableTitle.title: Editable title (fr)

message.deleteUser: You are going to delete the user {{user}} (fr).
message.deleteUserData: You are going to delete the user {{user}} data (fr).

messages.addHorizontal: Add following css to your stylesheet for horizontal borders (fr)
messages.addVertical: Add following css to your stylesheet for vertical borders (fr)

usage.builtInActionColumn: Table demonstrating built in actions column use case (fr)
usage.customCellDataFormatting: Table with custom cell data formatter (fr)
usage.withCustomFilter: Table with custom filter component and filterFn (fr)
usage.customStaticFilter: Table with custom  filter component and static filterFn (fr)
usage.rowSpecificActions: Table with actions menu items filtered based on row data logic (fr)
usage.tableBorderHorizontal: Table with custom style for horizontal border (fr)
usage.tableBorderVertical: Table with custom style for vertical border (fr)

message.subtitle: The Message component displays contextual messages with optional icons and a closable action. It supports custom slots, making it flexible for various use cases. (fr)

propertiesDescription.enableClose: Displays a close icon if true, allowing the message to be dismissed. (fr)
propertiesDescription.icon: Icon to display alongside the message. (fr)
propertiesDescription.message: The message text to display in the component. (fr)
propertiesDescription.onClose: Function to be called when the message is closed. (fr)
propertiesDescription.severity: Defines the styling severity of the message. Defaults to 'info'. (fr)
propertiesDescription.showIcon: Show default icon based on severity or custom icon if provided. (fr)

message.title: Message (fr)

modal.title: Modal (fr)

propertiesDescription.className: Additional CSS classes to apply to the modal. (fr)
propertiesDescription.onHide: Emitted when the modal is requested to close. (fr)
propertiesDescription.size: Defines the width of the modal. (fr)
propertiesDescription.visible: Controls the visibility of the modal. (fr)

modal.subtitle: A modal dialog component for displaying content in an overlay with support for custom headers, footers, and dismissal logic. (fr)

disableTabState.subTitle: By default, tab state is persisted between page refresh and navigations. You can disable this feature by passing persistState={false} prop to the component (fr)
disableTabState.title: State persistence disabled (fr)

disableTabState.subTitle: By default, tab state is persisted between page refresh and navigations. You can disable this feature by passing persistState={false} prop to the component (fr)
disableTabState.title: State persistence disabled (fr)

select.autoSortOptionsInfo: By default, options are sorted alphabetically. To render options in original order as provided, you can use autoSortOptions={false} (fr)
select.label: Country (fr)

propertiesDescription.autoSortOptions: By default, options are sorted alphabetically by label. If set to false, the order of options is preserved. (fr)
propertiesDescription.autoSelectSingleOption: If true, in case of single option it automatically gets selected. (fr)
propertiesDescription.disableGroupSelect: Remove checkbox on group label for selecting all group options. (fr)
propertiesDescription.disableSearch: Disables the search functionality inside the select component. (fr)
propertiesDescription.errorMessage: Displays an error message below the component. (fr)
propertiesDescription.enableTooltip: When enableTooltip is true, select component renders the <Tooltip> component for the selected value. (fr)
propertiesDescription.helperText: Displays a helper text below the component. (fr)
propertiesDescription.hideIfSingleOption: If there is only one option, and multiple is false, the Select component will not render the dropdown at all when set to true. (fr)
propertiesDescription.label: Label of the component. (fr)
propertiesDescription.labelKey: The key in option object to use as the display label. (fr)
propertiesDescription.multiple: If true, multiple selection is enabled. (fr)
propertiesDescription.name: Name of the component. (fr)
propertiesDescription.options: Options to pass in the select component. (fr)
propertiesDescription.showRemoveSelection: If true, icon to remove selected options is visible. (fr)
propertiesDescription.tooltipOptions: Options to customize the tooltipâ€™s behavior(example: position, offset). (fr)
propertiesDescription.valueKey: The key in option object to use as value. (fr)
propertiesDescription.renderOption: Function to be called to render custom select options. (fr)
propertiesDescription.renderValue: Function to be called to render custom select value. (fr)
propertiesDescription.onChange: Function to be called when value changes. (fr)

select.title: Select (fr)

switchInput.title: Switch input (fr)
switchInput.subtitle: The SwitchInput component is a customizable checkbox switch for toggling states. It supports additional properties such as error handling and labeling. (fr)
